<<<<<<< HEAD
The vveapon-salves maladie: or, A declaration of its insufficiencie to performe what is attributed to it Wherein also is described, 1. The severall wayes of making the weapon-salve. 2. The manner of vsing it. 3. Reasons of confirmation to justifie it. 4. Arguments of confutation to overthrow it. By the learned and judicious physitian Daniell Sennertus, Doctor and publique professor at Wittenberg. Translated out of his 5th. booke, part. 4. chap. 10. Practicæ medicinæ. Practicae medicinae. Booke 5. Part 4. English Sennerts, Daniel, 1572-1637.
[4], 29, [1] p.
Printed [by B. Alsop and T. Fawcet] for Iohn Clark, and are to be sold at his shop vnder St. Peters Church in Cornhill, London : 1637.
Printers' names from STC. An English translation of the fifth book of Daniel Sennerts' Practicæ medicinæ. Title page has left brace brackets from "The severall .. overthrow it". Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University. Library.
=======
